practice_cycles.focus_summary: Atomic Component Mastery and Local State
practice_cycles.short_explanation: I'll focus on building isolated UI elements and managing their internal state until I can predict how the UI responds to user input without looking at the console every time.

weekly_loop.primary_activity: Building small, functional UI components (forms, lists, buttons) using useState and useEffect.
weekly_loop.secondary_activity: Translating static HTML/CSS mockups into interactive React components.

difficulty_profile.comfortable: Creating static components and passing simple props.
difficulty_profile.challenging: Synchronizing side effects in useEffect and managing complex form state.

objective: Complete a library of 10 reusable UI components
Zero hydration or console errors during rendering
subjective: Increased confidence in knowing when a component will re-render
Less reliance on 'trial and error' for effect dependencies

practice_cycles.short_explanation: Now I'm moving toward intermediate patterns by connecting components and managing state across the whole application tree, dealing with more complex data fetching.

weekly_loop.primary_activity: Developing a multi-page application using React Router and managing global state via Context API.
weekly_loop.secondary_activity: Refactoring components to use custom hooks for shared logic.

difficulty_profile.comfortable: Standard prop drilling and basic routing.
difficulty_profile.challenging: Implementing efficient global state updates and handling race conditions in API calls.

objective: Build a functional CRUD application (e.g., Task Tracker or Dashboard)
Implementation of at least 3 custom hooks for data fetching or logic
subjective: Ability to visualize the state tree of the app before writing code
Feeling comfortable navigating a codebase with multiple folders and files

objective: Lighthouse performance scores for built applications
Successful implementation of complex hooks (useMemo, useCallback)
Passing test coverage for core business logic
subjective: Ease of reading and understanding open-source React libraries
Ability to explain the 'React way' of solving a problem to a peer
Reduced mental fatigue when debugging state-related issues

architect_notes: The 69-hour weekly commitment is unsustainable for long-term mastery; I have scheduled intense immersion but included a focus on refactoring to manage mental load.
The transition from beginner to intermediate hinges on mastering custom hooks and understanding the render cycle.
Project-based loops are prioritized to ensure the high time commitment translates into tangible artifacts.

details.reason: User initiated a new learning session.
